info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:08AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elbert, southeastern Hart, Laurens, southeastern Greenville, southern Spartanburg, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville, central Union and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 145 AM EST... At 107 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown to 9 miles west of Elberton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurens, Union, Abbeville, Elberton, Greenwood, Anderson, Simpsonville, Clinton, Fountain Inn and Belton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
